titleInfo.title: Letter from Captain Henry Hardy, in charge at Bushire to Major George Willock, Secretary in Charge of HM British Mission, Tabreze [Tabriz]

mods.abstract: The letter primarily concerns the forwarding of correspondence, and notes that a letter addressed to Major Willock was mutilated in transit. It also informs him that his request for funds from the Bushire treasury will be met.It further reports that Captain Hardy has received intelligence indicating that Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mirzā, Prince at Shiraz, intends to attack Bahrain and is soliciting the assistance of Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat.
